p:
The magnitude of precipitation variability change varies remarkably little across this wide range of timescales, maintaining an increase between 4 and 5% K −1 in the CMIP5 multi-model global land mean, with a modest decrease in magnitude toward longer timescales. The global average (including ocean) has a similar pattern with a slightly smaller increase, 3–4% K −1. The smaller increase over ocean might be related to the smaller warming there
40 , to soil-moisture feedbacks over land
41 , or to compensating regional changes over ocean.
